Question:
   1.A boy is standing at the bottom of the staircase. He needs to take a jump from the first index of the array which is the bottom of the staircase. The number of steps to be jumped are represented as an array. The boy needs to take jump if any of the further nearest values of the array is greater than the current element. Store the value in the result array if any such value exists else store 0.


Answer:
ans=[0]*len(arr)
stack=[]
for i in range(len(arr)):
     while stack and arr[stack[-1]]<arr[i]:
            top=stack.pop()
            ans[top]=arr[i]
     else:
        stack.append(i)
print(ans)
test case 1:
[6,5,4,3,2,1,7]

test case 2:
[4,2,7,1,5]

test case 3:
[6,7,8,9]

test case 4:
[1,3,5,2,4]

test case 5:
[52, 17, 86, 48, 44, 40, 56, 57, 71, 86, 69, 98, 46, 19, 60, 57, 57, 92, 49, 54, 91, 24, 84, 85, 46, 31, 30, 66, 46, 37, 73, 56, 36, 45, 19, 65, 94, 15, 42, 86, 46, 45, 82, 24, 30, 99, 37, 97, 66, 35, 39, 21, 24, 83, 32, 78, 37, 28, 81, 35, 37, 29, 70, 11, 20, 41, 86, 37, 89, 90, 16, 16, 32, 37, 49, 77, 35, 67, 37, 90, 13, 64, 83, 23, 51, 18, 76, 39, 92, 31, 54, 16, 14, 98, 60, 92, 18, 16, 57, 18]
